court: HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT
outcome: /JUDGMENT IN CC 557/2016 of J.M.F.C.-IIl,PALAKKAD PETITIONER(S)/ACCUSED: K.G.INDUCHOODAN S/O.GOPALAN, 62 YEARS, KUTHIRAYIL VEEDU, THIRUVALATHUR PO, PIRAYIRI, PALAKKAD. BY ADV. SRI.K.PBALAGOPAL RESPOND
full_text: i Br 2017/KER/955 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE SUNIL THOMAS MONDAY, THE 9TH DAY OF JANUARY 2017/19TH POUSHA, 1938 Cri.MC.No. 6986 of 2016 () AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 557/2016 of J.M.F.C.-IIl,PALAKKAD PETITIONER(S)/ACCUSED: K.G.INDUCHOODAN S/O.GOPALAN, 62 YEARS, KUTHIRAYIL VEEDU, THIRUVALATHUR PO, PIRAYIRI, PALAKKAD. BY ADV. SRI.K.PBALAGOPAL RESPONDENT(S)/COMPLAINANT: STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY RANGE FOREST OFFICER, OLAVAKKODE THROUGH PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.T.R.RANJITH THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 09-01-2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: i : Bins 2017/KER/955 Cri.MC.No. 6986 of 2016 APPENDIX PETITIONER(S) EXHIBITS ANNEXUE-1: CERTIFIED COPY OF THE MAHAZAR FIRST REPORT IN FORM NO.A1 WITH MAHAZAR AND FORM NO.I. ANNEXURE-2: TRUE COPY OF THE DOCUMENT NO.2991/2013 DATED 26/4/2013 OF SUB REGISTRAR'S OFFICE, PALAKKAD. ANNEXURE-3: TRUE COPY OF THE RECEIPT RECEIVED ON REMITTANCE OF TAX FOR THE PROPERTY FROM THE PIRAYIRI VILLAGE OFFICE DATED 26/12/2012. ANNEXURE-4: TRUE COPY OF THE POSSESSION CERTIFICATE OBTAINED BY THE PETITIONER FROM PIRAYIRI VILLAGE OFFICE ON 13/2/2015. ANNEXURE-5: TRUE COPY OF THE BUILDING PERMIT DATED 25/5/2015 GRANTED IN FAVOUR OF THE PETITIONER BY THE SECRETARY PIRAYIRI GRAMA PANCHAYATH. ANNEXURE-6: TRUE COPY OF THE ORIGINAL APPLICATION NO.37/2016 FILED BEFORE THE FOREST TRIBUNAL KOZHIKODE (CAMP PALAKKAD) DATED 18/4/2016. ANNEXURE-7: CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FOREST OFFENCE CHARGE SHEET IN FORM Il. RESPONDENT(S)' EXHIBITS NIL /f True copy /f PA. To Judge rmm 2017/KER/955 SUNIL THOMAS, J. Dated this the 9" day of January, 2017 ORDER The petitioner herein is the sole accused in C.C.No.557/2016 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate-II, Palakkad, for offence punishable under Section 27 (i) e, (iv) and (i) of Kerala Forest Act (Amendment Act, 1993), 1961. The crux of the allegation of the respondent is that, the petitioner herein had trespassed into the reserve forest, cleared the forest land, erected concrete fence posts, and thereby caused a loss of Rs.500/- to the Government. After investigation, final report was laid, for offences punishable under Sections 27(i) e(iv) and (i) of the Kerala Forest Act, 1961. The learned counsel for the petitioner relying on Annexure 2, title deed contended that the property has been validly assigned to the petitioner by the above registered documents and is in absolute possession of the property and that the land is not a forest land. 2. The learned Special Government Pleader for the forest, opposing the application, contended that the disputed property is rape 2017/KER/955 Crl.M.C.No. 6986 of 2016 2 a forest land. According to the counsel, the petitioner herein, had approached the Forest Tribunal, seeking exemption under Sections 3(2) and 3(3) of the Kerala Private Forests (Vesting and Assignment) Act, 1971. The learned counsel for the petitioner contented that, it was only an alternate prayer in the petition. Evidently, the question regarding the title, as now raised, is beyond the scope of consideration under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure. It is essentially for the courts vested with the appropriate authority, to adjudicate it and decide on the issue. Hence, I am not inclined to invoke Section 482 of the Cr.P.C. The Cri.M.C. fails and therefore, dismissed. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS , JUDGE. rmm/10/1/2017 // true copy // P.A to Judge rmm
